alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 18 at 11:20AM EDT until July 20 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Middlebury affecting Addison County. For the Otter Creek...including Middlebury...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Middlebury. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Creek Road and 3 Mile Bridge Road will continue to flood, and water will threaten lower portions of businesses on Bakery Lane and a few homes on Seymour Street near the covered bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Tuesday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to slowly fall, falling below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 04/21/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EDT.
